remarks: A meet's second argument is less than or equal to the meet. (Contributed by NM, 16-Sep-2011.)  (Revised by NM, 12-Sep-2018.)
statement:
meetval2.b $e |- B = ( Base ` K ) $.
meetval2.l $e |- .<_ = ( le ` K ) $.
meetval2.m $e |- ./\ = ( meet ` K ) $.
meetval2.k $e |- ( ph -> K e. V ) $.
meetval2.x $e |- ( ph -> X e. B ) $.
meetval2.y $e |- ( ph -> Y e. B ) $.
meetlem.e $e |- ( ph -> <. X , Y >. e. dom ./\ ) $.
lemeet2 $p |- ( ph -> ( X ./\ Y ) .<_ Y ) $.
